result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan R Marek

records.addlTxt: Transcript of October 17, 2016 Sentencing Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF269 and 15CF429 called together at 2:35pm [ma]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with Attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that case 15CF429 was read in and dismissed at the plea hearing; the Court will consider this case, but sentencing is occurring on case 15CF269
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Graber submits documents in support of Mr. Marek
--Statement made by Defendant's sister
--Statement made by Mr. Marek

On Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CF269, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--On Count #3: to serve 75 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/ work-release privileges, to commence on 10/28/16 at 6:00 pm.
The Court authorizes transfer of conditional jail to another county, so long as it is served as an actual sentence, that is without electronic monitoring

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No contact with: Cassandra Marek, unless approved by the Department of Corrections & agreed to by Cassandra Marek
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified Batterers Intervention programming
--No acts or threats of violence
--statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharges

--to submit DNA sample

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
recess: 3:15pm
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF269 and 15CF429 called together at 2:06pm [MA]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with Attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CF269; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CF269 and Case 15CF429.

recess: 2:21pm 

NEXT: Sentencing on 10/17/16 at 2:30pm
Request for relief from Scheduling Order
Jury trial on September 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Order

Cases 15CF269 and 15CF429 called together at 10:30am [mo]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with Attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  ADA Jeffrey Shock  appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Graber requests that the cases be scheduled for Trial
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court distributes its scheduling order; counsel reviews
recess: 10:38am

NEXT: Case 15CF269: (1)FSSC on 9/12/16 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 9/15 and/or 9/16/16 at 8:30am
             Case 15CF429: (1)FSSC on 9/19/16 at 1:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 9/22/16 at 8:30am
State's
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 10:20 am.

[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch III]
Cases 15CF269 and 15CF429 called together at 8:37am [mo]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with Attorney Katherine Jean Graber.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF429, Preliminary Hearing occurs:

Detective Leah Meyer -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--cross examination by Attorney Graber 

ADA Shock requests that the Court takes Judicial Notice of the bond in case 15CF269; the Court will and does
Arguments given by Counsel; bind over requested by ADA Shock

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Marek committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--speedy trial waived

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 9:09am

NEXT: As to Both Cases (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/27/16 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 6/28/16 at 10:30am
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 15CF429 and 15CF269 called together at 9:03am [mo]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

With no objection, the Court schedules 15CF429 for Preliminary Hearing, 15CF269 should follow as status.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 9:06am

NEXT: Prelimniary Hearing (15CF429)/Status Conference (15CF269) on 3/29/16 at 8:30am
for Substitution of Attorneys
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys
Status conference at 03-08-2016 09:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-27-2016 10:20 am
Attorney Lippert
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF269 and 15CF429 called together at 10:13am [mo]
Defendant Dylan R Marek in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF429(Initial Appearance occurs):
Attorney Lippert specially appears on this case, as Mr. Marek needs to go to the SPD office to have counsel appointed on this case. 
The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No Direct or Indirect Contact with Cassie Marek
--No Discussion of the Case with the Juveniles: M.L., A.B. or I.M.
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling, Cases are to be scheduled together for PTC and STC. 
recess: 10:21am 

NEXT:  As to Both Cases  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/27/16 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 3/8/16 at 9:00am
